ygData.msgSnippet: That s it - I m gone.  I ve had it. If I can t get any respect, I ll go somewhere that I m appreciated. Somewhere that gives a shit that some of its members

That's it - I'm gone.  I've had it.

If I can't get any respect, I'll go somewhere that I'm appreciated.  
Somewhere that gives a shit that some of its members aren't complete 
Internet junkies that have nothing better to do than hang around one 
website all day.

In short, somewhere a hell of a lot better than this piece of shit!  
As of right now, every character I've got has ceased to exist within 
the confines of NBW.  Empath, Synergy, Wheeljack-X, Phoenix, 
Pumpskin, Flicker (unless dewboy wants him back), Skyblaze, and the 
Rogues are gone.  Vanished without a trace.  Forever.  And so am I!

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> OOC: It's to be expected. We have a lot of members playing with 
multiple characters, in a fast moving story. Not all of us talk to 
each other on IM to post that way. If you cant handle reading the 
amount of emails then you shouldn't be in a email based RPG.
>  
> Too sum up my over all feeling... TOO BAD!
> 
> cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, EmprzAnastazia@a... wrote:
> > In a message dated 6/4/03 6:49:40 AM Central Daylight Time, 
> > cardhead649@y... writes:
> > 
> > 
> > > OOC: URGH!  What is it with people always having to blitz-post 
> around 
> > > here?  I thought there was an agreement to put a lid on it!  
> Maybe I 
> > > should leave after all - certainly there's no shortage of other 
> RPG's 
> > > that actually respect members who can't be online 24-7!!!!!!
> > > 
> > > 
> > 
> > Sorry.. my bad...  
> > 
> > Stac
> 
> This isn't the first time either - and there shouldn't have BEEN a 
> first time, let alone a second or third, or whatever the count's 
made 
> it up to now.  You're not the only one, Stac; Airly, Raccoon (when 
> she's on), and Robo are all guilty.  I know I've missed a few 
people, 
> but you guys are the worst culprits.  Sorry if it looks like I'm 
> overreacting, but there's just no excuse for this.  If every 
> character was involved in something, I could imagine having to read 
a 
> page and a half of entries, but this is ridiculous.
> 
> No excuse.  Period.
>
